definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: A theory which is not refutable by any conceivable event is non-scientific.
sentences.chinese: 不被任何可以想见的事件驳斥的理论则不具科学性。

sentences.english: Predictably, teammates ply Wang with amusing phrases. On a recent flight, he greeted Larry Bowa.
sentences.chinese: 可以想见的是，队友们也会教小王一些垃圾话。

sentences.english: Invite those people you want to meet to join you.
sentences.chinese: 邀请那些你想见的人来加入你的组织。

sentences.english: This is surely the most short-sighted policy you could imagine.
sentences.chinese: 这绝对是你可以想见的最目光短浅的政策。

sentences.english: If you want to meet your spirit guide, you need to be doing a soul mind OBE.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想见你的指导灵，你需要去做精神心灵出窍。

sentences.english: It is said that the Herd-boy and Waving-girl can meet only on that evening every year.
sentences.chinese: 传说，牵牛和织女每年只有在在这个时候才能想见。

sentences.english: If you want to meet them,I can arrange it.
sentences.chinese: 你如果想见他们，我可以安排会见。

sentences.english: Lincon wanted to see his son once.
Answer, Kagome. Do you wish to see him?
sentences.chinese: 戈薇，回答我，你想见他么。

sentences.english: I want to see Mr. Matthews.
I want to see Mrs. Bramley.
Master Oogway, you summoned me? ls something wrong?
sentences.chinese: 乌龟大师，你想见我？有什么事吗。

sentences.english: Ranya told me she just wanted to see her mother.
sentences.chinese: 兰娅告诉我说，她只是想见她的母亲。

sentences.english: It is not hard to see why the Sputnik era appeals to Mr Obama.
sentences.chinese: 不难想见为什么史泼尼克时代那么吸引奥巴马先生。

sentences.english: He is very eager to meet you, and sends his warmest regards.
sentences.chinese: 他非常想见您，要我先代他向您致敬。

sentences.english: It is a moneymaking proposition he wants to see you about.
sentences.chinese: 他想见你是要谈生意经。

definition: to see each other/to meet in person
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to show one's face/to appear (in public)
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to meet with (sb who is paying a visit)/CL:次[ci4]
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
